Comment: Since Donald Trump became President, Trump Derangement Syndrome (TDS) has reached all-time highs. Those who are afflicted still cannot grasp that their worst nightmare has been realized, that Trump is back in the White House, doing what he actually said he would do. The problem: Many of those who suffer the most severe cases of TDS are also federal employees.
Author: Sure-Wishbone-4293

Comment: I knew it was bad, but I didn't know it was **This Bad.**❗️👀  >The data, released Thursday by the Napolitan Institute, shows that 76% of voters for former Vice President Kamala Harris working under Trump say they will “resist” his plans, while 75% say they would hypothetically disobey, or “do what [they] thought was best,” when given a legal order that they disagreed with.
Author: GiediOne

Comment: The support numbers aren't surprising, but the amount that would actively disobey orders is kinda crazy. Just because I disagree with my boss doesn't mean I get to make up my own rules. They would not last very long in the private sector with that kind of mindset.
Author: eschwifty
